Present location: INSTITUT DE PAPYROLOGIE ET D'ÉGYPTOLOGIE, UNIVERSITÉ DE LILLE III [02/049] LILLE
Name: "Tulip" vase
Description: Very crude example of a ''tulip'' vase. The wide thick base is flattened and very worn. The cylindrical body has a flared tapered lip. The clay is fine, shiny and red with black rim. The traditional white band has here been reduced to a few irregular white patches. This vessel was part of a deposit placed beneath the bed of the deceased, near its head, and was held up with pebbles.
